bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SERRANO:H.R. 352.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 2 of section 5 of article I of the Constitution:Each House may determine the Rules of its Proceedings, punishits Members for disorderly Behaviour, and, with theConcurrence of two thirds, expel a Member.''Clause 2 of section 3 of article IV of the Constitution:``The Congress shall have Power to dispose of and make allneedful Rules and Regulations respecting the Territory orother Property belonging to the United States; and nothing inthis Constitution shall be so construed as to Prejudice anyClaims of the United States, or of any particular State.''[Page H356]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

summary.text: Amends the Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 1987 to allow the Clerk of the House of Representatives, at the request of a Member of the House, to donate computers and related peripheral tools previously used by the Member to a public elementary or secondary school designated by such Member without regard to whether the donation: (1) is a cost to the government; or (2) has a recoverable value.

bill.title: To permit members of the House of Representatives to donate used computer equipment to public elementary and secondary schools designated by the members.

item.title: To permit members of the House of Representatives to donate used computer equipment to public elementary and secondary schools designated by the members.
To permit members of the House of Representatives to donate used computer equipment to public elementary and secondary schools designated by the members.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
